DOC.brief_summary: The primary aim of the study was to assess whether D-Dimer level at entry or an increase of D-Dimer level during the follow-up could predict the occurrence of subsequent cardiovascular events in patients with atrial fibrillation.
DOC.brief_title: To Assess the Predictive Value of D-dimer Level on the Occurrence of Cardiovascular Events
DOC.detailed_description: Patients will be followed-up every 4 months with clinical assessment and D-dimer blinded measurement.
DOC.criteria: atrial fibrillation followup not possible, poor prognosis within 3 months
DOC.keyword: atrial fribrillation, cardiovascular events, aging, D-dimer
